title: Converting from Standard Form to Vertex Form

content.problem: Convert the quadratic function f(x) = 2x² - 12x + 19 to vertex form and identify the vertex.
steps:
Step 1: Factor out the leading coefficient (a) from the first two terms
f(x) = 2(x² - 6x) + 19

Step 2: Complete the square inside the parentheses
To complete the square for x² - 6x, take half the coefficient of x, square it, and add and subtract it
Half of -6 is -3, and (-3)² = 9
f(x) = 2(x² - 6x + 9 - 9) + 19
f(x) = 2((x - 3)² - 9) + 19

Step 3: Distribute and simplify
f(x) = 2(x - 3)² - 18 + 19
f(x) = 2(x - 3)² + 1

Step 4: Identify the vertex from the vertex form
The vertex form is f(x) = a(x - h)² + k where (h, k) is the vertex
Comparing with our result: h = 3, k = 1
So the vertex is (3, 1)
content.explanation: Converting to vertex form by completing the square allows us to easily identify the vertex. This method works for any quadratic function and is especially useful when the vertex isn't easily found using the formula.
